title: Conjugate prior
summary: In Bayesian probability theory, if the posterior distribution p ( θ ∣ x ) {\displaystyle p(\theta \mid x)} is in the same probability distribution family as the prior probability distribution p ( θ ) {\displaystyle p(\theta )} , the prior and posterior are then called conjugate distributions, and the prior is called a conjugate prior for the likelihood function p ( x ∣ θ ) {\displaystyle p(x\mid \theta )} .
